alert.note: Alert for Cass; Marion (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 7:16PM CST until February 01 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Black Cypress Bayou At Jefferson affecting Cass and Marion Counties. For the Black Cypress Bayou...including Jefferson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Cypress Bayou at Jefferson. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Lowland flooding will affect mainly timber resources. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 13.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Tuesday was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 10.6 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.6 feet on 12/23/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 730 PM CST.
